section.title: Description
section.para: Invoke Object Tools's Visual Eiffel Compiler.

section.title: Parameters

listitem.para: Domain: Valid filename pointing to existing file
Domain: Valid filename pointing to existing file
Description: Name of variable holding the compiler process's return code after it's run
Domain: Intgeger (usually 0 for OK, and any other number for not OK)
Default: `Void' (no variable is set if attribute is not specified)

section.para: Note: In mode 'clean' the directory 'eCluster' and the files Result.out', 'vec.xcp' are deleted as well if they exist. If 'recursive' is set to 'true' 'clean' is applied to each subdirectory recursively. In mode tune the Eiffel System is tuned with Visual Eiffel's tuner. Visual Eiffel 5.0 uses Xace files. When both 'esd' and 'xace' attributes are specified, only 'esd' is taken into account.

section.title: RNG Specification
section.programlisting: <define name="ve"> <element name="ve"> <ref name="dir_if_unless"/> <choice> <attribute name="esd"/> <attribute name="xace"/> <group> <attribute name="clean"/> <optional> <attribute name="recursive"/> </optional> </group> <group> <attribute name="tune"/> <optional> <attribute name="level"> <!-- runtime evaluation <choice> <value>large</value> <value>huge</value> </choice> --> </attribute> </optional> </group> </choice> </element> </define>

section.title: Examples
section.programlisting:
<ve esd="compile_ve.esd"/>
<ve xace="compile_ve.xace"/>
<ve clean="kernel" recursive="true"/>
<ve tune="${system}${exe}" level="${vetuner}" if="${vetuner}"/>
